definitions.definition: the process or skill of applying a substance to something so as to change its original color.
the process of filling in a particular shape or outline with crayons.
visual appearance with regard to color, in particular.
the arrangement of colors and markings on an animal.
the natural hues of a person's skin, hair, and eyes.
the pervading character or tone of something.
examples: the comments give a distinctly more ideological coloring to research conclusions

definitions.definition: a substance used to give a particular color to something, especially food.
change the color of (something) by painting, dyeing, or shading it.
examples: tint, dye, stain, paint, pigment, wash the wood was colored blue
the foliage will not color well if the soil is too rich

definitions.definition: use crayons to fill (a particular shape or outline) with color.
examples: color the head, eyes, and bill with crayons
he has colored the dance with gestures from cabaret and vaudeville

definitions.definition: (of a person or their skin) show embarrassment or shame by becoming red; blush.
examples: everyone stared at him, and he colored slightly

definitions.definition: cause (a person or their skin) to change in color.
(of a particular color) imbue (a person's skin).
examples: a faint pink flush colored her cheeks

definitions.definition: (of an emotion) imbue (a person's voice) with a particular tone.
influence, especially in a negative way; distort.
examples: the experiences had colored her whole existence
witnesses might color evidence to make a story saleable
synonyms: manipulate "they color evidence to make a story sell"
